alert.note: Alert for Johnston (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 24 at 7:59AM EDT until March 24 at 9:00AM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: The National Weather Service in Raleigh has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Central Johnston County in central North Carolina... * Until 900 AM EDT. * At 759 AM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 8 miles north of Benson, or 10 miles west of Smithfield, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Smithfield, Clayton, Micro, Selma, Kenly, Emit, Coats Crossroads, Flowers and Buckhorn Reservoir. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. If you spot a tornado go at once into the basement or small central room in a sturdy structure. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
